food_allergies.name: Burger
food_allergies.description: An allergy to ingredients commonly found in burgers, such as beef, bread, and condiments like ketchup or mustard.
common_symptoms: Swelling of the face, lips, tongue, or throat
avoidance_tips: Read ingredient labels carefully
Ask about ingredients when dining out
Consider alternatives like veggie burgers

food_allergies.name: French Fries
food_allergies.description: An allergy to potatoes or certain oils used in frying.
common_symptoms: Swelling of the face, lips, tongue, or throat
avoidance_tips: Inquire about the type of oil used for frying
Consider alternatives like sweet potato fries or other sides

food_allergies.name: Pizza
food_allergies.description: An allergy to ingredients commonly found in pizza, such as cheese, wheat in the crust, and tomato sauce.
common_symptoms: Swelling of the face, lips, tongue, or throat
avoidance_tips: Opt for cheeseless or dairy-free pizza options
Consider gluten-free crust alternatives
Choose pizzas with alternative sauces like pesto

food_allergies.name: momos
food_allergies.description: An allergy to ingredients commonly found in momos, such as wheat flour for the dough and various fillings like meat or vegetables.
common_symptoms: Swelling of the face, lips, tongue, or throat
avoidance_tips: Ask about ingredients when ordering
Consider making homemade momos with allergy-friendly ingredients
Opt for momos with alternative fillings

food_allergies.name: noodles
food_allergies.description: An allergy to ingredients commonly found in noodles, such as wheat or eggs.
common_symptoms: Swelling of the face, lips, tongue, or throat
avoidance_tips: Choose rice noodles or noodles made from alternative grains like rice or buckwheat
Read labels carefully for hidden wheat or egg ingredients

food_allergies.name: pasta
food_allergies.description: An allergy to ingredients commonly found in pasta, such as wheat in the pasta dough and ingredients in the sauce.
common_symptoms: Swelling of the face, lips, tongue, or throat
avoidance_tips: Opt for gluten-free pasta options made from alternative grains like rice or corn
Choose pasta sauces without common allergens like tomatoes or cheese

food_allergies.name: tomato
food_allergies.description: An allergy to tomatoes or tomato-based products.
common_symptoms: Swelling of the face, lips, tongue, or throat
avoidance_tips: Avoid foods containing tomatoes or tomato sauce
Read ingredient labels carefully
Opt for alternative sauces like pesto or Alfredo

food_allergies.name: Egg
food_allergies.description: Egg allergies are common in children and can cause mild to severe reactions.
avoidance_tips: Avoid foods containing eggs (e.g., baked goods, mayonnaise, certain sauces)
Read ingredient labels carefully
Use egg substitutes in cooking and baking

food_allergies.name: soyabean
food_allergies.description: Soybean allergies can cause various symptoms, including skin reactions, gastrointestinal issues, and respiratory problems.
avoidance_tips: Read food labels carefully for soy ingredients
Avoid soy-based products (e.g., tofu, soy sauce, edamame)
Be cautious of hidden soy in processed foods

food_allergies.name: Fish
food_allergies.description: Fish allergies can cause severe reactions and may develop at any age.
avoidance_tips: Avoid eating fish altogether
Be cautious of cross-contamination in restaurants
Read food labels carefully for fish ingredients

food_allergies.name: corn
food_allergies.description: Corn allergies are less common but can cause various symptoms, including skin reactions and gastrointestinal issues.
avoidance_tips: Avoid corn and corn-derived products (e.g., corn syrup, cornstarch, cornmeal)
Read food labels carefully
Choose alternative grains and sweeteners

food_allergies.name: banana
food_allergies.description: Banana allergies are less common but can cause various symptoms, including skin reactions and gastrointestinal issues.
avoidance_tips: Avoid banana and banana-containing products
Read food labels carefully
Inform others about the allergy to prevent accidental exposure

food_allergies.name: rice
food_allergies.description: Rice allergies are less common but can cause various symptoms, including skin reactions and gastrointestinal issues.
avoidance_tips: Avoid rice and rice-containing products
Read food labels carefully
Inform others about the allergy to prevent accidental exposure

food_allergies.name: tea
food_allergies.description: Tea allergies are less common but can cause various symptoms, including skin reactions and gastrointestinal issues.
avoidance_tips: Avoid tea and tea-containing products
Read food labels carefully
Inform others about the allergy to prevent accidental exposure

food_allergies.name: Apple
food_allergies.description: Apples are a popular fruit known for their sweet taste and crisp texture. They are a rich source of fiber and various vitamins and minerals.
common_symptoms: swelling of lips, tongue, or throat
avoidance_tips: Avoid consuming raw apples
Consider cooking or baking apples to denature the allergens
Read food labels carefully for hidden sources of apples

food_allergies.name: Orange
food_allergies.description: Oranges are citrus fruits known for their tangy taste and high vitamin C content. They are commonly consumed fresh or in the form of juice.
avoidance_tips: Be cautious with orange-flavored foods and drinks
Consider alternative citrus fruits like lemons or limes
Consult with an allergist for personalized advice

food_allergies.name: Coconut
food_allergies.description: Coconuts are tropical fruits known for their versatility. They provide coconut water, milk, oil, and flesh, each with unique culinary uses.
common_symptoms: swelling of lips, tongue, or throat
avoidance_tips: Check food labels for coconut-derived ingredients
Use alternative ingredients like almond or soy milk
Avoid foods cooked in coconut oil

food_allergies.name: Mango
food_allergies.description: Mangoes are tropical fruits prized for their sweet and tangy flavor. They are often eaten fresh, dried, or used in smoothies and desserts.
common_symptoms: swelling of lips, tongue, or throat
avoidance_tips: Be cautious with mango-containing products like juices and chutneys
Wash hands thoroughly after handling mangoes to prevent skin contact
Consider alternative fruits like papaya or pineapple

food_allergies.name: Papaya
food_allergies.description: Papayas are tropical fruits with a sweet and musky flavor. They are known for their vibrant orange flesh and black seeds and are often eaten fresh or used in salads and smoothies.
common_symptoms: swelling of lips, tongue, or throat
avoidance_tips: Avoid consuming raw papayas if allergic
Be cautious with papaya-containing skincare products
Consult with an allergist for personalized advice

food_allergies.name: Kiwi
food_allergies.description: Kiwi fruits, also known as Chinese gooseberries, are small, fuzzy fruits with a tangy and slightly sweet flavor. They are rich in vitamin C and fiber.
common_symptoms: swelling of lips, tongue, or throat
avoidance_tips: Peel kiwis carefully to minimize exposure to allergens
Avoid kiwi-flavored foods and drinks
Consider alternative fruits like strawberries or pineapple

food_allergies.name: Grapes
food_allergies.description: Grapes allergy is a reaction of the immune system to certain proteins found in grapes. It can manifest as various symptoms, ranging from mild to severe.
common_symptoms: Swelling of the lips, tongue, or throat
avoidance_tips: Read food labels carefully to avoid products containing grapes or grape derivatives.
Be cautious when dining out or consuming processed foods, as grapes may be used as ingredients or additives.
Inform restaurant staff about your allergy to ensure safe food preparation.
Consider carrying an epinephrine auto-injector (such as an EpiPen) if you have a severe grape allergy.
